;nature's beauty,
;but my heavy heart
;shan't raise my heads high
;to look past my skin;
;black, so black.
;No it's not evil
;nor d symbol of d devil,
;my skin

Death is notin @ all

;speak 2 me in d easy way

;Put no difference in ur tone

;of solemnity or sorrow.
;Laugh,

;Pray! Smile! Think of me!
;Pray 4 me!
;Let my name b ever
;b d household word
;that it always was,
;let it b spoken without effect;
;without d trace
;of a shadow in it.
;Life means
;all that it ever meant!
;It is d same
;as it ever was;

;Why should i be

;I am waiting 4 u,

Every morning i awake
;i enjoin my heart
;2 sing n pray.
;Yet i remember that in my life
;He's placed an angel everyday
;2 guide me at any point in time.
;So in my heart
;i begin 2 pray:
;
;"OH GOD!
;Grant me the sight of my angel
;yet another day.
;Let not a spot
;blot out it's brightness,
;let not a feather be shed,
;lest it's beauty whithers.
;Protect it's colour
;so as 2 heighten our happiness
;and make it remember
;it's duty; assigned by our Maker,
;2 become
;'My Every Morning Angel' "
;
;So when the sun has risen
;and men chase ends meet
;upon the earth
;it'll be adorned in her liken
;to pay my heart a visit,
;and guide me through the day
;till her exit at night
;when i'm in YOUR safe care.
; Alas! I sleep and await another morrow
;whence she'll gladly be "MY EARLY MORNING ANGEL".
